result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason Paul Blue was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jason Paul Blue is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jason Paul Blue was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent to 15CM462.
Concurrent without prejudice to consecutive if revoked.
Defendant to report to Probation today April 21, 2016.
Court has no objection to Probation ending after 1 year if all conditions are met.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: 15CM462

miscConds.notes:

DNA surcharge.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex.

AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

records.addlTxt: Reason for Change: Terminated - Regular.             Restitution = $0.00, Court Obs = $0.00 and Supv fees = $340.00. eif
c: Def, Atty, DA, SCSO & E: Probation. eif
Filed by Atty Demaio. Re: Conditions of Probation. km               Per SRN 4/28/16 - amend to NAC. eif
signed by Def & Atty this date. eif

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung DF ATTY: Daniel Frank Demaio DF:Jason Paul Blue appeared. Case called at 1:39. Includes 16CM76, 15CM462. ADA Hartung updates the Court.  Atty. DeMaio agrees.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1  in15CM462 removing the domestic abuse enhancer and G  to Ct. 4 in 16CM76. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1  in 15CM462 removing the domestic abuse inhancer and guilty of Ct 4 in 16CM76. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 1, 2, 3 in 16CM76. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders: Sentence W/H
On 15CM462
18 mo. probation with conditions:
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times . This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- AODA and any recommended follow through.
- Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex.
- DE to have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Cheryl G or Cary L.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person. 
- Costs of 243.00
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $200.
- Apply bond on file.

On 16CM76
18 mo. probation with conditions the same as in 15CM462
Concurrent to 15CM462
Probation is concurrent without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation revocation.
- Costs of 243.00
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $200.00.


Court has no objection to probation to end after a year if conditions are successfully met. 
DE to reportto probation today. Bond will be discharge once DE reports.
filed by ADA M. Hartung. gme
Pre-trial conference on April 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on April 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

CO: EJL, RPR: Val Deiss, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:  Megan E. Kelly, Atty Daniel DeMaio, Jason Paul Blue appears. Court questions Defendant. Court quashes stayed warrant. Bond continues in form and amount.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Return on warrant on April 1, 2016 at 01:05 pm.

Apprs: CO Proctor for SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Megan E. Kelly, NONA by def. Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. Case called at 4:40. ADA Kelly updates the court and requests a Warrant STAYED until 04-01-2016. Court authorizes a Warrant and STAYS it.  Return on warrant scheduled for April 1, 2016 at 01:05 pm.
Michael Blue ck# 025700 sent this date. eif

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Cheryl G.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: SRN, RPR: Vicki Kasten, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:  Matthew L Hartung, Jason Paul Blue pro se. Defendant will hire an attorney. Court confirms address.  Court questions Defendant and find he is competent to proceed. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 24, 2016 at 04:30 pm.
